{"step_by_step_thinking": "Atropine sulphate is an anticholinergic medication. Its intramuscular administration to a 50 kg adult may produce effects such as increased heart rate (tachycardia) due to its blockade of the vagus nerve, rather than bradycardia. Salivation and sweating are also cholinergically mediated processes that would be decreased by atropine. Mydriasis is dilation of the pupils, which is a classic effect of anticholinergic medications like atropine.", "answer_choice": D}
